title: How to Record Hands‐Free on TikTok on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Open TikTok on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open TikTok on your iPhone or iPad. It’s the black icon with a white music note inside.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . It’s at the bottom-center part of the screen.

steps.title: Position your iPhone or iPad in preparation to record.
steps.content: Position your iPhone or iPad in preparation to record. You can put it on a tripod if you have one or just lean it against something. Just make sure the viewfinder is showing where you want it to capture.

steps.title: Tap the stopwatch icon.
steps.content: Tap the stopwatch icon. It's towards the bottom of the icon column on the right side of the screen.

steps.title: Select when you want your recording to end.
steps.content: Select when you want your recording to end. Drag the pink line along the timeline to indicate how long you want your video to be; the app will stop recording automatically at that point.

steps.title: Tap Start Countdown.
steps.content: Tap Start Countdown . A countdown will begin (3, 2, 1…). When the countdown ends, TikTok will begin recording immediately. There’s no need to press the recording button, though. To pause the recording, tap the stop button at the bottom of the screen. To start recording hands-free after pausing, tap the timer icon again.

steps.title: Tap the checkmark when you're finished recording.
steps.content: Tap the checkmark when you're finished recording. It's at the bottom right of the screen.

steps.title: Edit your video and tap Next.
steps.content: Edit your video and tap Next . Use the editing options at the top and bottom of the screen to adjust the way your video looks.

steps.title: Add a caption and tap Post.
steps.content: Add a caption and tap Post . It's the pink button at the bottom of the screen. Your hands-free video is now shared on TikTok.
